body.p: Future income tax cash flows may affect recoverable amount. It is convenient to analyse future tax cash flows into two components:

li.p: the future tax cash flows that would result from any difference between the tax base of an asset (the amount attributed to it for tax purposes) and its carrying amount, after recognition of any impairment loss. Such differences are described in IAS 12 Income Taxes as ‘temporary differences’.
the future tax cash flows that would result if the tax base of the asset were equal to its recoverable amount.
